clues.text: (Sarah of the Clue Crew presents from Bowery Farms in Kearny, NJ.) Indoor farming can consume 95% less water than traditional methods & doesn't require application of these chemicals that release more than 5 billion pounds of contaminants into the environment each year

On Sunday,heis so last week
Cited by Machiavelli & used as a political weapon:"Divide & ____"

An autobiography(6)

(Sarah of the Clue Crew presents from Bowery Farms in Kearny, NJ.) Bowery tends its crops with a proprietary automated operating system that monitors every step of the growing process, beginning withthisfirst stage, from Latin for "to sprout"
Composer Debussy & painter Monet
The obstacle course in this NBC competition is based on one at Mount Midoriyama in Japan
Associated with architect Mies van der Rohe:"Less is ____"
The purchase was derisively calledthisman's "Folly", after the Secretary of State who led the effort to buy Alaska
Faustian fiend(14)

(Sarah of the Clue Crew presents from Bowery Farms in Kearny, NJ.) The practice of vertical farming dates to antiquity, with historic examples including the 2000-year-oldrice terracesof the Philippines &thispossibly legendary one of the seven wonders of the ancient world
Political radical Marat & philosopher Sartre (it's hyphenated)
She's been on TV as a teen detective & a resident of "The Good Place"
While "one good turn deserves another", be warned that "no good deed goes ____"
One reason Russia sold was fear of not being able to access Alaska after this 1850s war reduced its sea power
A statement of views, like a Communist one(9)

(Sarah of the Clue Crew presents from Bowery Farms in Kearny, NJ.) It's projected that by 2050 two-thirds of Earth's population will live in cities far from traditional food sources; indoor vertical farming brings fresh produce to urban areas withthissoil-free growing process, from Greek words meaning "water" & "labor"
Painter Pissarro & composer Saint-Saens

U.S. canneries established after the sale led to the world's largest industry for this fish
A short lyrical love poem, often set to music(8)

(Sarah of the Clue Crew presents from Bowery Farms in Kearny, NJ.) Urban farming also has a long tradition; in both World Wars I and II, patriotic ads encouraged city-dwellers across America to grow food in these gardens with a winning name
Actress Signoret & writer de Beauvoir

Alluding to a pompous puppet character:"Pleased as ____"
